thread.title: RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Couple victimized hundreds in mail theft operation, police say
thread.title_full: RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Couple victimized hundreds in mail theft operation, police say - Press Enterprise

author: ALI TADAYON
title: RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Couple victimized hundreds in mail theft operation, police say
text:
BY ALI TADAYON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 13, 2015 Updated: 4:47 p.m. RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Couple victimized hundreds in mail theft operation, police say Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article Â» POLICE SEEK INFORMATION The investigation into the mail theft operation remained ongoing Tuesday. The Sheriff's Department asks that anyone with information regarding the operation contact the Rancho Cucamonga Station at 909-477-2800. Calls wishing to remain anonymous can call the We-Tip Hotline at 1-800-78-CRIME (27463). Tipsters can also leave information on the We-Tip website at www . wetip .com
A Rancho Cucamonga couple was arrested Thursday, Oct. 8, and Friday on suspicion of stealing mail from hundreds of Rancho Cucamonga residents.
Jason Moon and Teresa Goede, both 35, were booked into jail on suspicion of identity theft, according to a San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department news release. Their arrests came after a month-long investigation into a mail theft scheme that also involved identity theft, credit card fraud, check fraud, theft, and burglary, the news release said.
Sometime during the last month, deputies got a tip about a "suspicious vehicle near a community mailbox" in Rancho Cucamnonga. That tip led detectives to identity Moon as the primary suspect in a string of mail thefts.
Deputies obtained a search warrant and served it at Moon's home Thursday, Oct. 8. Though Moon wasn't there, deputies located hundreds of pieces of stolen mail, homemade mailbox keys, computers and printers used to make fraudulent checks, and dozens of fraudulent checks made payable to Moon, the news release said. Deputies also found a loaded pistol at the home.
During the search, Goede was contacted. She was arrested on a felony warrant for identity theft.
The next day, deputies tracked down Moon to a home in Ontario. He was found in the attic of the home and taken into custody. Two people were additionally arrested Friday on suspicion of obstructing Moon's arrest.
The investigation into the mail theft operation remained ongoing Tuesday. The Sheriff's Department asks that anyone with information regarding the operation contact the Rancho Cucamonga Station at 909-477-2800. Calls wishing to remain anonymous can call the We-Tip Hotline at 1-800-78-CRIME (27463). Tipsters can also leave information on the We-Tip website at www.wetip.com
